you don't have to be a senator to make a

and I would hope that U and and this is
something which is enormously inspiring
now because when I go to schools and
colleges I find so many of the young
people uh want to be involved in helping
to solve the problems maybe not running
for elective office but in in trying to
solve the problems we've seen that in
National magazines in recent times and
one of the very very important parts of
an education bill that we have just
passed in the House and Senate and the
president will sign will be loan
forgiveness for students who generally
have
$20,000 uh of indebtedness when they
graduate some much more but it'll be
loone forgiveness for those that want to
be involved in working in their
Community to help solve the problems
maybe as a teacher it maybe as a nurse
it may be as a prosecutor maybe as a
legal Defender maybe as a childcare
worker maybe working with special needs
of children maybe working on an Indian
Reservation uh we've been very Broad in
terms of what we have defined on that to
try and to say to the young people of
this country you know if you're a person
that is able to get admission to a
school and college cost should not be
the barrier for you and when you
graduate debt should not be a barrier
for your ability to make a contribution
to the country to give something back to
the community uh for all that is given
to you and for something to give back to
the nation uh that's kind of spirit is
Alive and Well gets back to your earlier
question about the state of our
democracy as long as that kind of spirit
is out there this country will be safe
and secure
